column4: hi I've switched form the GUI login to the login SHELL and I need help, I want to be able to use irssi with out having to leave my login shell, however my internet won't work unless i run 'startx' and enter my login password in a prompt any ideas on what could help me?
you mean you are using 'wireless' internet?
you need to set wireless up some how to work at boot without network manager it seems.
not really.
perl is not to hard to learn.. and can be real handy.
the more languages you learn the easier it is to learn new ones. :)
/var/run/* starts under your root dir.
and i think /var/run/samba is made by samba when it starts up.  just not sure how to prove that.
learn the basics..  its handy at times.. and learning 'regular expressions' will help in many other languages
check /etc/init/gdm.conf - if that exists. upstart is handling gdm. reame the file to be /etc/init/gdm.DONTSTART  or simil;er to disable it.
if you aer doing reinstalls.. why not just install 10.10 to begin with?
1)because I'm lazy and alredy have 10.4 on a usb drive
i think it would be better  to do a clean install of 10.10
would that be better than using update manager since that doesn't seem to be workin for me?
since it would proberly actually work.. id say yes.
and since upgradeing would download the whole cd anyway and more....
Thank you :)
plus you would then have a 10.10 cd/iso/flash drive........
why WOULD you want to upgrade :)
use dd, back it up.. restore it as needed..
export the new PATH.    in .bashrc or .profile normally.. -> export PATH=$PATH:new/path/path
smw: never mind I was logged in as root logging out fixed the problem
does it look funny now?
